com.barryholroyd.bluetoothchatdemo.activity_chooser

Class ChooserClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.barryholroyd.bluetoothchatdemo.activity_chooser.ChooserClient

  • public class ChooserClient
extends java.lang.Object
    Bluetooth "chat" client connection set up.

    Given a remote device, create a connection to it and then call start ChatActivity to connect a chat session.

    This was originally a worker thread, but since only one connection is allowed at a time that only introduced a lot of complexity, so I now do the connection set up on the main thread and make the user wait.

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public static void connect(android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice btdevice)
        Create a connection to a remote Bluetooth server and then pass it to ChatServer to connect the chat session. This thread exits after spawning the communication thread. The check to ensure that Bluetooth is enabled is done before starting this worker thread.
        Parameters:
        btdevice - remote Bluetooth device.

      • closeSocket

        private static void closeSocket(android.bluetooth.BluetoothSocket btSocket)
        Local method to close the btSocket if it hasn't been passed to ChatServer yet.
